title: Google\Cloud\Container\V1\ClusterUpdate
name: ClusterUpdate
description:
ClusterUpdate describes an update to the cluster. Exactly one update can be applied to a cluster with each request, so at most one field can be provided.

Generated from protobuf message google.container.v1.ClusterUpdate

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

methods.name: __construct
methods.description: Constructor.

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.desired_node_version
params.description: The Kubernetes version to change the nodes to (typically an upgrade). Users may specify either explicit versions offered by Kubernetes Engine or version aliases, which have the following behavior: - "latest": picks the highest valid Kubernetes version - "1.X": picks the highest valid patch+gke.N patch in the 1.X version - "1.X.Y": picks the highest valid gke.N patch in the 1.X.Y version - "1.X.Y-gke.N": picks an explicit Kubernetes version - "-": picks the Kubernetes master version

params.name: data.desired_monitoring_service
params.description: The monitoring service the cluster should use to write metrics. Currently available options: "monitoring.googleapis.com/kubernetes" - The Cloud Monitoring service with a Kubernetes-native resource model monitoring.googleapis.com - The legacy Cloud Monitoring service (no longer available as of GKE 1.15). * none - No metrics will be exported from the cluster. If left as an empty string,monitoring.googleapis.com/kubernetes will be used for GKE 1.14+ or monitoring.googleapis.com for earlier versions.

params.name: data.desired_addons_config
params.description: Configurations for the various addons available to run in the cluster.

params.name: data.desired_node_pool_id
params.description: The node pool to be upgraded. This field is mandatory if "desired_node_version", "desired_image_family" or "desired_node_pool_autoscaling" is specified and there is more than one node pool on the cluster.

params.name: data.desired_image_type
params.description: The desired image type for the node pool. NOTE: Set the "desired_node_pool" field as well.

params.name: data.desired_database_encryption
params.description: Configuration of etcd encryption.

params.name: data.desired_workload_identity_config
params.description: Configuration for Workload Identity.

params.name: data.desired_mesh_certificates
params.description: Configuration for issuance of mTLS keys and certificates to Kubernetes pods.

params.name: data.desired_shielded_nodes
params.description: Configuration for Shielded Nodes.

params.name: data.desired_cost_management_config
params.description: The desired configuration for the fine-grained cost management feature.

params.name: data.desired_dns_config
params.description: DNSConfig contains clusterDNS config for this cluster.

params.name: data.desired_node_pool_autoscaling
params.description: Autoscaler configuration for the node pool specified in desired_node_pool_id. If there is only one pool in the cluster and desired_node_pool_id is not provided then the change applies to that single node pool.

params.name: data.desired_locations
params.description: The desired list of Google Compute Engine zones in which the cluster's nodes should be located. This list must always include the cluster's primary zone. Warning: changing cluster locations will update the locations of all node pools and will result in nodes being added and/or removed.

params.name: data.desired_master_authorized_networks_config
params.description: The desired configuration options for master authorized networks feature.

params.name: data.desired_cluster_autoscaling
params.description: Cluster-level autoscaling configuration.

params.name: data.desired_binary_authorization
params.description: The desired configuration options for the Binary Authorization feature.

params.name: data.desired_logging_service
params.description: The logging service the cluster should use to write logs. Currently available options: logging.googleapis.com/kubernetes - The Cloud Logging service with a Kubernetes-native resource model logging.googleapis.com - The legacy Cloud Logging service (no longer available as of GKE 1.15). * none - no logs will be exported from the cluster. If left as an empty string,logging.googleapis.com/kubernetes will be used for GKE 1.14+ or logging.googleapis.com for earlier versions.

params.name: data.desired_resource_usage_export_config
params.description: The desired configuration for exporting resource usage.

params.name: data.desired_vertical_pod_autoscaling
params.description: Cluster-level Vertical Pod Autoscaling configuration.

params.name: data.desired_private_cluster_config
params.description: The desired private cluster configuration.

params.name: data.desired_intra_node_visibility_config
params.description: The desired config of Intra-node visibility.

params.name: data.desired_default_snat_status
params.description: The desired status of whether to disable default sNAT for this cluster.

params.name: data.desired_release_channel
params.description: The desired release channel configuration.

params.name: data.desired_l4ilb_subsetting_config
params.description: The desired L4 Internal Load Balancer Subsetting configuration.

params.name: data.desired_datapath_provider
params.description: The desired datapath provider for the cluster.

params.name: data.desired_private_ipv6_google_access
params.description: The desired state of IPv6 connectivity to Google Services.

params.name: data.desired_notification_config
params.description: The desired notification configuration.

params.name: data.desired_authenticator_groups_config
params.description: The desired authenticator groups config for the cluster.

params.name: data.desired_logging_config
params.description: The desired logging configuration.

params.name: data.desired_monitoring_config
params.description: The desired monitoring configuration.

params.name: data.desired_identity_service_config
params.description: The desired Identity Service component configuration.

params.name: data.desired_service_external_ips_config
params.description: ServiceExternalIPsConfig specifies the config for the use of Services with ExternalIPs field.

params.name: data.desired_enable_private_endpoint
params.description: Enable/Disable private endpoint for the cluster's master.

params.name: data.desired_master_version
params.description: The Kubernetes version to change the master to. Users may specify either explicit versions offered by Kubernetes Engine or version aliases, which have the following behavior: - "latest": picks the highest valid Kubernetes version - "1.X": picks the highest valid patch+gke.N patch in the 1.X version - "1.X.Y": picks the highest valid gke.N patch in the 1.X.Y version - "1.X.Y-gke.N": picks an explicit Kubernetes version - "-": picks the default Kubernetes version

params.name: data.desired_gcfs_config
params.description: The desired GCFS config for the cluster

params.name: data.desired_node_pool_auto_config_network_tags
params.description: The desired network tags that apply to all auto-provisioned node pools in autopilot clusters and node auto-provisioning enabled clusters.

params.name: data.desired_gateway_api_config
params.description: The desired config of Gateway API on this cluster.

params.name: data.desired_node_pool_logging_config
params.description: The desired node pool logging configuration defaults for the cluster.

methods.name: getDesiredNodeVersion
methods.description:
The Kubernetes version to change the nodes to (typically an upgrade).

Users may specify either explicit versions offered by Kubernetes Engine or version aliases, which have the following behavior:

  • "latest": picks the highest valid Kubernetes version
  • "1.X": picks the highest valid patch+gke.N patch in the 1.X version
  • "1.X.Y": picks the highest valid gke.N patch in the 1.X.Y version
  • "1.X.Y-gke.N": picks an explicit Kubernetes version
  • "-": picks the Kubernetes master version

methods.name: getDesiredMonitoringService
methods.description:
The monitoring service the cluster should use to write metrics.

Currently available options:

  • "monitoring.googleapis.com/kubernetes" - The Cloud Monitoring service with a Kubernetes-native resource model
  • monitoring.googleapis.com - The legacy Cloud Monitoring service (no longer available as of GKE 1.15).
  • none - No metrics will be exported from the cluster. If left as an empty string,monitoring.googleapis.com/kubernetes will be used for GKE 1.14+ or monitoring.googleapis.com for earlier versions.

  • logging.googleapis.com - The legacy Cloud Logging service (no longer available as of GKE 1.15).

  • "1.X": picks the highest valid patch+gke.N patch in the 1.X version
  • "1.X.Y": picks the highest valid gke.N patch in the 1.X.Y version
  • "1.X.Y-gke.N": picks an explicit Kubernetes version
  • "-": picks the default Kubernetes version

Generated from protobuf field string desired_master_version = 100;

params.name: var
params.description:
The Kubernetes version to change the master to.

Users may specify either explicit versions offered by Kubernetes Engine or version aliases, which have the following behavior:

  • "latest": picks the highest valid Kubernetes version
  • "1.X": picks the highest valid patch+gke.N patch in the 1.X version
  • "1.X.Y": picks the highest valid gke.N patch in the 1.X.Y version
  • "1.X.Y-gke.N": picks an explicit Kubernetes version
  • "-": picks the default Kubernetes version
